persichetti.core.resonance module

class persichetti.core.resonance.OvertoneSeries(base_freq=110.0, num_partials=16)[source]

Bases: object

Generates the first N overtones of a fundamental frequency.

display()[source]
persichetti.core.resonance.amplify_existing_overtones(chord, partials=8, tolerance_cents=25)[source]

Suggests pitches that reinforce overlapping overtones in the chord.

Returns:

Each dict has the following keys:

  • ’pitch’: Pitch object

  • ’reinforced_by’: list of (source_pitch, harmonic_number)

Return type:

list of dict

persichetti.core.resonance.brilliance_score(chord, context=None)[source]

Returns a score for how well a chord’s intervals align with overtone spacing. Higher score = more ‘brilliant’.

persichetti.core.resonance.resonance_profile(chord, context=None)[source]

Prints a musical profile of the chord’s resonance qualities. Includes: - Brilliance score - Suggested resonance supports - Suggested reinforcement tones with overtone sources

persichetti.core.resonance.suggest_supporting_tones(bass_pitch: Pitch)[source]

Returns a list of pitches that lie a fifth and a ninth below the given pitch. These help reinforce overtone resonance.
